summary: This is an internal FBI email forwarding a Miami Herald editorial that calls for an independent federal investigation into the plea deal negotiated by then-U.S. Attorney Alexander Acosta for Jeffrey Epstein. The editorial criticizes Acosta's actions as 'egregious' and a 'farce'.

persons.name: Alexander Acosta
persons.role: Former U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida
persons.context: The subject of the Miami Herald editorial, which criticizes his role in negotiating a 'sweetheart' federal plea deal for Jeffrey Epstein while serving as U.S. Attorney.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a 'Palm Beach multimillionaire and serial sexual predator' who received a favorable federal plea deal negotiated by Alexander Acosta.

connections.description: Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, negotiated a federal plea deal for Epstein, which the editorial criticizes as overly lenient and improperly coordinated with Epstein's defense team.

events.title: Miami Herald Editorial Calls for Investigation
events.description: The Miami Herald publishes an editorial calling for an independent federal investigation into the 'egregious' plea deal negotiated by Alexander Acosta for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Negotiation of Epstein Plea Deal
events.description: Reference to the past event where Alexander Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, negotiated a federal plea deal for Jeffrey Epstein, allegedly caving to the demands of Epstein's legal team and limiting the FBI investigation.

keyFacts: The Miami Herald editorial characterizes the federal plea deal for Jeffrey Epstein negotiated by then-U.S. Attorney Alexander Acosta as a 'sweetheart deal' and 'egregious'.
The editorial alleges Acosta 'repeatedly caved to the demands' of Epstein's 'high-powered lawyers' and worked with them to limit the scope and publicity of the FBI investigation.
The editorial calls for an independent federal investigation into Acosta's actions regarding the Epstein case.
This internal FBI email shows the editorial's criticism was being circulated within the FBI's Violent Crimes Against Children unit.
